Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Milestone 1: Skeleton Android TV app with alarm timer

Complete working Android TV alarm clock skeleton:

- AlarmActivity with flashing "ALARM!" display
- BootReceiver placeholder for re-registering alarms after reboot
- Compose for TV UI with dark theme
- TV banner and adaptive icon
- All required permissions \(USE_EXACT_ALARM, WAKE_LOCK, BOOT_COMPLETED\)

Test: Press "Set Alarm" -> alarm fires 30 seconds later -> screen shows ALARM!

EOF
\)")

Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Milestone 2: Streaming app launcher with 18 services

New features:
- StreamingApp enum with 18 services: Netflix, YouTube, Hulu, Disney+,
  Prime Video, Max \(HBO\), Sling TV, Peacock, Paramount+, Apple TV+,
  Tubi, Pluto TV, Crunchyroll, YouTube TV, fuboTV, Discovery+, Plex, Starz
- StreamingLauncher deep link engine with app-specific quirks
  \(Netflix source=30 extra, YouTube vnd:// scheme, Hulu activity targeting\)
- ContentPickerScreen with scrollable app cards and content ID input
- HomeScreen updated with "Pick Streaming App" button and selected app display
- MainActivity navigation between Home and ContentPicker screens
- Brand-colored streaming app cards with D-pad focus support
- Quick test IDs for YouTube and Netflix deep link testing
- Error handling for apps not installed / launch failures

18 supported streaming services with deep link formats.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix streaming app detection with alternate package names

Streaming apps have different package names on different devices:
- YouTube TV: com.google.android.youtube.tv \(not .youtube\)
- Max/HBO: com.wbd.stream \(was com.hbo.hbonow, then com.hbo.max.android.tv\)
- YouTube TV service: com.google.android.youtube.tvunplugged

Added altPackageNames field to StreamingApp enum so we check the primary
package AND all known alternates. StreamingLauncher now uses
findInstalledPackage\(\) to detect which variant is actually installed.

Verified on emulator: YouTube, Hulu, Sling, Prime Video, Paramount+,
and Max \(HBO\) are all correctly detected now.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix package detection on API 33+: use PackageInfoFlags API

On Android 13+ \(API 33\), getPackageInfo\(String, int\) is deprecated.
Updated to use getPackageInfo\(String, PackageInfoFlags\) on newer APIs
with fallback for older versions. This should fix apps showing as
"Not Installed" even when they are present on the device.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add QUERY_ALL_PACKAGES permission to detect installed streaming apps

On Android 11+ \(API 30+\), apps cannot see other installed packages
by default due to package visibility restrictions. Without this
permission, getPackageInfo\(\) throws NameNotFoundException for every
app, making them all appear as "Not Installed". This was the root
cause of the detection bug.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add URL-based content selection and auto-launch on alarm

Major upgrade to content selection and alarm launch flow:

- NEW: StreamingContent data model for saved content selections
- NEW: UrlParser - paste a URL from any browser and we auto-detect the
  streaming service and extract the content ID. Supports Netflix, YouTube,
  Hulu, Disney+, Prime Video, Max/HBO, Paramount+, Peacock, Crunchyroll,
  Tubi, and Pluto TV URL formats.
- NEW: Two content selection modes:
  1. "Paste a Link" - user pastes a URL, we parse it automatically
  2. "Just Open an App" - for live TV \(Sling, Pluto\) or resume watching
- NEW: Content saved to SharedPreferences so AlarmReceiver can access it
- NEW: AlarmActivity now shows 10-second countdown before auto-launching
  the selected streaming content. Press any button to cancel.
- AlarmReceiver reads saved content and passes it to AlarmActivity
- Full end-to-end flow: set alarm → pick content → alarm fires →
  countdown → streaming app auto-launches with specific content

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add search-based launching for shows without known content IDs

When you pick a show \(like Friends on HBO\), the app now opens the
streaming app and searches for the show by name instead of needing
a proprietary content ID.

Changes:
- New LaunchMode.SEARCH: opens app with search query for the show name
- StreamingLauncher.launchWithSearch\(\): 3-tier strategy:
  1. App-specific search deep link \(e.g., play.max.com/search?q=Friends\)
  2. Android SEARCH intent targeted at the app
  3. Global media search intent
  4. Fallback: just open the app
- Search URLs for 12 streaming apps \(Netflix, HBO, Hulu, Disney+, etc.\)
- StreamingContent now stores searchQuery field
- AlarmReceiver passes search query to AlarmActivity
- Episode picker uses SEARCH mode when no deep link ID is available

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add auto-profile-select to click past streaming app profile screens

When the alarm launches a streaming app \(Netflix, HBO Max, Hulu, Disney+, etc.\),
many apps show a "Who 's Watching?" profile picker that blocks content from playing.
This adds ProfileAutoSelector which sends simulated D-pad key presses after a delay
to auto-click the default profile, so the show starts playing even when asleep.

- ProfileAutoSelector sends DPAD_CENTER + ENTER key events via shell commands
- Only triggers for apps known to have profile screens \(10 apps listed\)
- Only active during alarm launches \(disabled for test launches from ContentPicker\)
- Cancels pending key presses if user manually dismisses the alarm
- Fails silently if device blocks shell key injection

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Redesign home screen with multi-alarm support, test button, better focus states, and new icon

Major UI overhaul:
- Replace single 30-sec alarm with full time picker \(hour/min/AM-PM with arrow buttons\)
- Support multiple alarms: add, delete, toggle ON/OFF, all persisted to SharedPreferences
- Add "Test Alarm Now" button that fires alarm in 2 seconds for instant testing
- Split home screen into left \(clock + streaming info\) and right \(alarm list\) layout

Button focus/hover fix:
- Create TVButton component with proper Android TV D-pad focus states
- Default: subtle color tint with border, Focused: full color fill + white border + 1.08x scale
- Pressed: darker fill. All buttons across HomeScreen and ContentPickerScreen use TVButton
- Much clearer which button is selected when navigating with remote

New app icon:
- Alarm clock with play button triangle in the center \(streaming + alarm concept\)
- Deep navy blue background with subtle glow
- Clock details: hour markers, hands pointing to 7:00, alarm bells, stand legs
- Play button in teal \(matches app accent color\)
- Updated TV banner with matching dark navy + accent stripe

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix AM/PM placement in time picker - move to right side as single toggle button

AM/PM was vertically centered between the up/down arrows of hour and minute,
making it look like it was floating in the middle of the numbers. Now it sits
to the right as a single toggle button aligned to the bottom of the row,

Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix app icon and auto-profile-select with AccessibilityService

Icon fix:
- Manifest was pointing to @drawable/ic_launcher_foreground instead of
  @mipmap/ic_launcher — the adaptive icon \(foreground+background\) was
  never being used. Now uses proper @mipmap/ic_launcher and roundIcon.
- Added ic_launcher_round.xml for round icon support.

Auto-profile-select fix:
- Runtime.exec\("input keyevent"\) requires INJECT_EVENTS permission which
  is system-only — it was silently failing on every device.
- Replaced with AccessibilityService approach: AlarmAccessibilityService
  runs with elevated permissions that CAN inject key events to other apps.
- User enables it once in Settings > Accessibility.
- HomeScreen shows orange warning banner with "Open Accessibility Settings"
  button when the service isn''t enabled yet.
- Service does nothing except dispatch key events when asked — no data
  collection, no screen reading.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix clock AM/PM, app icon PNGs, real streaming app icons, accessibility service

Clock fix:
- Split time display into time + AM/PM as separate elements
- Time shows large \(80sp\), AM/PM shows smaller \(28sp\) in teal to the right
- AM/PM sits at the bottom of the time, not floating in the middle

App icon fix:
- Generated actual PNG mipmap files for all densities \(mdpi through xxxhdpi\)
- Alarm clock with play button on dark navy background
- Now properly shows in Android TV launcher

Streaming app cards:
- Load REAL app icons from installed apps via PackageManager.getApplicationIcon\(\)
- Shows the actual Netflix N, HBO logo, etc. from the installed app
- Falls back to text-only card if app isn''t installed
- Also improved card focus/pressed/border states for TV navigation

Accessibility service fix:
- Completely removed Runtime.exec\("input keyevent"\) which was causing freezes
- Now uses proper accessibility tree: finds focused node and clicks it
- Set canRetrieveWindowContent=true \(needed for rootInActiveWindow\)
- Reduced event listening to only typeWindowStateChanged
- No shell commands, no key injection, just accessibility ACTION_CLICK

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add configurable deep link system with JSON config and multi-scheme fallback

- Create assets/deep_link_config.json with verified URI schemes for all 18 apps
- Create DeepLinkConfig.kt to load/cache config from JSON at startup
- Update StreamingApp.kt to read overrides from config with hardcoded fallbacks
- Rewrite StreamingLauncher to try multiple URI schemes per app with automatic
  fallback chain: primary scheme → alternate schemes → app-only launch
- Fix deep link URIs: Netflix \(nflx:// primary\), YouTube \(vnd.youtube://\),
  Hulu \(hulu:// + force-stop quirk\), Prime Video \(amzn:// alternate\),
  fuboTV \(added com.fubo.tv alt package for Android TV\)
- Add intentExtras, intentClassName, searchUrl, needsForceStopBefore per app
- Remove hardcoded app-specific switch/when in buildIntent, now config-driven
- Config version field for tracking updates when streaming apps change

To fix a broken deep link: edit deep_link_config.json, bump configVersion, rebuild.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add DeepLinkResolver: runtime deep link discovery and verification engine

New three-tier deep link system:
  Tier 1: VERIFIED formats from DeepLinkResolver \(proven to work on THIS device\)
  Tier 2: CONFIG formats from JSON file \(community-curated\)
  Tier 3: HARDCODED formats in StreamingApp enum \(last resort\)

DeepLinkResolver probes all installed streaming apps at startup using
resolveActivity\(\) — no apps are actually launched. Results are cached
in SharedPreferences and re-probed when apps update or every 24 hours.

- DeepLinkResolver.kt: Full discovery engine with probing, caching,
  app update detection, pattern generation, and failure reporting
- StreamingApp.kt: getDeepLinkFormats\(\) now returns 3-tier ordered list
- StreamingLauncher.kt: Reports failed formats to resolver, re-probes
  on total failure, loads resolver cache on init
- MainActivity.kt: Calls probeAll\(\) at startup

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Wire up TMDB watch providers, external IDs, and improve fallback chain

Search results now show which streaming apps have each show/movie:
- Fetches watch providers from TMDB for top 5 search results
- Shows green checkmark if content is on the selected app
- Shows other available apps if content is elsewhere

TMDB external IDs integration:
- New getExternalIds\(\) in TmdbApi fetches IMDB IDs from TMDB
- ContentIdMapper.getContentIdWithFallback\(\) tries curated map first,
  then IMDB IDs for apps that accept them \(Prime Video, Apple TV+\)

Improved fallback chain in StreamingLauncher:
- When all deep link formats fail: re-probe → try search → app-only
- LaunchResult.displayMessage\(\) centralizes user-friendly error messages
- AlarmActivity now tries searching by content title as fallback
- Episode search queries include season number for better results

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

EOF
\)")

Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix launcher crashes and broken deep link/automation logic

- Fix NPE crash in triggerAutomationPhase when no launch intent is found
  \(was passing null to startActivity\)

\)")

Fix profile bypass: double-tap DPAD_CENTER + key injection + focus nav

Bash(git -c user.name="mcsfeb" -c user.email="mcsfeb@users.noreply.github.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix profile bypass: use real DPAD key events instead of accessibility actions

The core problem was that bypassProfileScreen\(\) used clickFocused\(\) and
moveFocus\(\) which relied on accessibility ACTION_CLICK and focusSearch\(\) -
neither of which work on other apps'' UI trees on Android TV. TV apps only
respond to real DPAD key events. Fixed by making sendKeyEvent\(\) \(shell
input keyevent\) the PRIMARY method throughout all bypass phases and
navigation recipes, with accessibility actions as a bonus-only fallback.

Also tightened profile detection keywords to prevent false positives on
home screens, and included Gemini''s other improvements: ContentLauncher
hybrid strategy, memory leak prevention, SettingsScreen, and coroutine-
based automation.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
